en-us.learning_promise:
This unit introduces your students to Earth and Space Science as well as Life Science through a relatable focus on animals. They’ll begin close to home, designing a structure that will keep a pet safe in stormy weather. Next, they'll explore animal life cycles and group behavior. Then, they will develop a plan to reduce the impact on animals of a change to a wetland environment. Finally, they’ll share a wild animal and habitat of their choice and explain how the animal is adapted to survive in that habitat.  

Your students will also practice their social and emotional learning, such as self-regulation, persistence, empathy, self-awareness, and mindfulness with the main characters in the lesson stories.  

Before your students begin this unit, we recommend the following to support their building and programming skills and prepare them for the challenges in this unit. 

- Access the LEGO® Education SPIKE™ [App][1] or install it on classroom devices.  

- Complete the Tutorial Activities (under the Start menu item in the LEGO Education SPIKE App). 

- Try one or more of the lessons in the [Happy Traveler](https://education.lego.com/en-us/lessons/spikeessential-happy-traveler) unit.  

- In addition, find [professional development](https://pd.legoeducation.com/pages/37/homeroom-premium) support for hands-on learning, programming, and coding. (Create a free LEGO ID if you don’t have one.) 



 


  [1]: https://education.lego.com/en-us/downloads/spike-app/software

lessons.lesson_description: Daniel learned that strong storms can damage pet houses. Help him design a pet house that keeps animals safe even in storms.
lessons.student_worksheet_description: Daniel learned that strong storms can damage pet houses. Help him design a pet house that keeps animals safe in storms

text.content:
Daniel learned that strong storms can damage pet houses. 
Help him design a pet house that keeps animals safe in storms.
What are some hazards that weather like storms can cause?

How do people design buildings to reduce these hazards?
Choose one hazard to build for.

Build a pet house that protects against your chosen storm hazard.
Use the model in the picture for ideas if you like.

code_stack.title: SPIKE Essential Science Preparing for the Weather
code_stack.xml: <xml xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" blockversion="12" ishorizontal="false" displaymonitorincludedimages="11"><variables></variables><block type="flipperevents_whenProgramStarts" id="-P6,3VOhsnS4Px{l}cbh" x="-99" y="279"><next><block type="flippersound_playSoundUntilDone" id="7Rf!.`$#(#66:sQvZ_{^"><value name="SOUND"><shadow type="flippersound_sound-selector" id="5R3|pje,$zybpt$t3Gzs"><field name="field_flippersound_sound-selector">{"name":"Dog Bark 1","location":"device"}</field></shadow></value><next><block type="flippermotor_motorTurnForDirection" id="4kX1qJgG1);9eHcMj+$g"><field name="UNIT">rotations</field><value name="PORT"><shadow type="flippermotor_multiple-port-selector" id="h3psCABH{z$TRJT==n^2"><field name="field_flippermotor_multiple-port-selector">A</field></shadow></value><value name="DIRECTION"><shadow type="flippermotor_custom-icon-direction" id="0G%JZ1$l.X1f@^5864XI"><field name="field_flippermotor_custom-icon-direction">clockwise</field></shadow></value><value name="VALUE"><shadow type="math_number" id=",Fdd{RYTyl:yU=rK2e$C"><field name="NUM">150</field></shadow></value></block></next></block></next></block></xml>

text.content:
Program a way to protect your pet house from storms.
You can also program to show the storm or its damage.
Show lightning. Use a tilt sensor to show if the building tips.
Use your model and program to explain what storm hazard problems your design protects against.
Use your model and program to explain how your design will protect the pet house from this hazard.
Use your model and program to explain your reasons for choosing this design.
Keep building your pet house model. Keep programming it.

Use it to make a claim. 
How will your design protect the pet?
Remember to include evidence like reasons.
Great job!

teacher_support.things_you_will_need:
(one for every two students)
- LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Essential Set
- Device with the LEGO Education SPIKE App installed

lessons.title: SPIKE Essential Preparing for the Weather

lessons.lesson_description: Leo learned that tadpoles are baby frogs. He wonders how other animals and plants change as they grow.
lessons.student_worksheet_description: Leo learned that tadpoles are baby frogs. He wonders how other animals and plants change as they grow.

text.content:
Leo learned that tadpoles are baby frogs. 
He wonders how other animals and plants change as they grow.

Frogs change from eggs to tadpoles to adult frogs to old frogs during their life cycle. 
What stages do some other animals complete?

What about plants? 
How do they change during their life cycle?
These life cycles all include birth, growth, making new animals or plants, and aging.
Choose a plant or animal life cycle to show in a model.

Build models. 
Show Leo four parts of the life cycle you chose.
Build a platform. 
Show that the life cycle is a repeating pattern.

code_stack.title: SPIKE Essential Life Cycles
code_stack.xml: <xml xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" blockversion="12" ishorizontal="false" displaymonitorincludedimages="11"><variables></variables><block type="flipperevents_whenProgramStarts" id="y2}KCBamfq6nQ?x0OrSd" x="-143" y="23"><next><block type="control_repeat" id="w++xqW#w}K|t=qQW+I_u"><value name="TIMES"><shadow type="math_whole_number" id="*.C5@}{Ur%W}$lKKWe^^"><field name="NUM">4</field></shadow></value><statement name="SUBSTACK"><block type="flippermotor_motorTurnForDirection" id="U7=iUK@vF:;e8YXL@#Y("><field name="UNIT">degrees</field><value name="PORT"><shadow type="flippermotor_multiple-port-selector" id="a^`FJc~;188/Svv+rG=*"><field name="field_flippermotor_multiple-port-selector">A</field></shadow></value><value name="DIRECTION"><shadow type="flippermotor_custom-icon-direction" id="6-1Dn2xDol/ht+$/ZlOt"><field name="field_flippermotor_custom-icon-direction">clockwise</field></shadow></value><value name="VALUE"><shadow type="math_number" id="kUdm:RSd8xVjvTE:xi`["><field name="NUM">90</field></shadow></value><next><block type="flippersound_playSoundUntilDone" id="sB5qUVxbg8`Yj~NMyfKt"><value name="SOUND"><shadow type="flippersound_sound-selector" id="8LMaT[@:@%X.TjWY.!oa"><field name="field_flippersound_sound-selector">{"name":"Tada","location":"device"}</field></shadow></value><next><block type="control_wait" id="PJd2xCz)CQ6dsWlGKTO,"><value name="DURATION"><shadow type="math_positive_number" id="i*[nGbQ-y}xA(Ug3YQy{"><field name="NUM">1.5</field></shadow></value></block></next></block></next></block></statement></block></next></block></xml>

text.content: Program your platform to spin.

Use your model to explain;
The plant or animal you chose.
What life cycle stages you showed.
Changes during the life cycle.

Keep building your models and programs.
For example, you can add sounds for each life stage.
Compare your model to the ones your classmates made: what pattern does each life cycle show?
Compare your model to the ones your classmates made: how are the life cycles the same and different?
Great job!

teacher_support.things_you_will_need:
(one for every two students)
- LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Essential Set
- Device with the LEGO Education SPIKE App installed

lessons.title: SPIKE Essential Life Cycles

lessons.lesson_description: Maria sees that African buffalo live in large herds. She wonders why they live in groups rather than on their own.
lessons.student_worksheet_description: Maria sees that African buffalo live in large herds. She wonders why they live in groups rather than on their own.

text.content: Maria sees that African buffalo live in large herds. She wonders why they live in groups rather than on their own.
What are some animals that live in herds?

How does living in a herd help these animals survive? 
How does it help them stay safe?

Build an African buffalo.
Put a color sensor on its head.

Point the sensor down. 
That is where the buffalo’s food is.

code_stack.title: SPIKE Essential Animal Behavior
code_stack.xml: <xml xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" blockversion="12" ishorizontal="false" displaymonitorincludedimages="11"><variables></variables><block type="flipperevents_whenColor" id="p|%0OJ34BZZVXM0Y]EJp" x="-136" y="46"><value name="PORT"><shadow type="flipperevents_color-sensor-selector" id=")^KFv!T/`J0nF0G?j)yn"><field name="field_flipperevents_color-sensor-selector">A</field></shadow></value><value name="OPTION"><shadow type="flipperevents_color-selector" id="GYFnQ`KGv[JB`{=oQh93"><field name="field_flipperevents_color-selector">7</field></shadow></value><next><block type="flippersound_playSoundUntilDone" id="3lm5#|9T[MpIMN4%Z8bN"><value name="SOUND"><shadow type="flippersound_sound-selector" id="$REzIf`t?b_zXs^q/uh:"><field name="field_flippersound_sound-selector">{"name":"Moo","location":"device"}</field></shadow></value></block></next></block></xml>

text.content:
Use a LEGO® piece as a predator. 
Make it yellow.
Program your buffalo. 
Have it make a sound when it sees a predator.

Use your model to explain; 
How can the buffalo notice a predator.

Use your model to explain;
Why might an animal eating grass not see danger until it is near?

Change your model. 
This time, point the color sensor forward.

Show how your buffalo can see a predator. 
How is this different than your first model?
How can having some animals watch help the herd?
Great job!

teacher_support.things_you_will_need:
(one for every two students)
 - LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Essential Set
 - Device with the LEGO Education SPIKE App installed
 - See Prepare - Materials.

lessons.title: SPIKE Essential Animal Behavior

lessons.lesson_description: Sofie learned that people will put a building in the wetland near her home. She’s worried it will hurt the birds and other animals that live there.
lessons.student_worksheet_description: Sofie learned that people will put a building in the wetland near her home. She’s worried it will hurt the birds and other animals that live there.

text.content:
Sofie learned that people will put a building in the wetland near her home. 
She’s worried it will hurt the birds and other animals that live there.

What is a wetland? 
What kinds of birds and other animals live there?

What problems would a building cause for them?
Choose one to explore. 
Think about how to solve it.

Talk about the problem you chose.
What will change for your animal? 
What will it need now?

Design and build a solution to help the animal. 
Try sketching first. 
Or use the picture for ideas.

code_stack.title: SPIKE Essential Solving Problems When Environments Change
code_stack.xml: <xml xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" blockversion="12" ishorizontal="false" displaymonitorincludedimages="11"><variables></variables><block type="flipperevents_whenProgramStarts" id=")We$2+W`QtK.IjoAje5F" x="-134" y="17"><next><block type="flippersound_playSoundUntilDone" id="[JvGK~kjxJPt|U0`rujE"><value name="SOUND"><shadow type="flippersound_sound-selector" id="^I(#UlG:t{*bu|BI!JWU"><field name="field_flippersound_sound-selector">{"name":"Siren Whistle","location":"device"}</field></shadow></value><next><block type="flippermotor_motorTurnForDirection" id="~)cif+iv}QQ]ID}dpKH_"><field name="UNIT">degrees</field><value name="PORT"><shadow type="flippermotor_multiple-port-selector" id=":uuCZzMV{)1.}gH)!}_I"><field name="field_flippermotor_multiple-port-selector">A</field></shadow></value><value name="DIRECTION"><shadow type="flippermotor_custom-icon-direction" id="QEmXjl_o.8L`)/;}~#0B"><field name="field_flippermotor_custom-icon-direction">clockwise</field></shadow></value><value name="VALUE"><shadow type="math_number" id="$^|H8u-euShZZ,72?He."><field name="NUM">85</field></shadow></value></block></next></block></next></block></xml>

text.content:
Program your model.
Use the sample program for ideas if you build the birdhouse.
(Or, program the door to open for the little bird.)

Use your model and program to explain; 
what will change in the wetlands.

Use your model and program to explain; 
what problem does this cause for your animal?

Use your model and program to explain; 
how your design will solve the problem.

Keep building and programming your wetlands solution. 
Use it to make a claim about how your design will help the animal after people start building.
Great job!

teacher_support.things_you_will_need:
(one for every two students)
 - LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Essential Set
 - Device with the LEGO Education SPIKE App installed
 - See Prepare - Materials.

lessons.title: SPIKE Essential Solving Problems When Environments Change

lessons.lesson_description: Sofie, Daniel, Maria, and Leo visit a desert. They wonder how the animals and plants survive where it is so dry.
lessons.student_worksheet_description: Sofie, Daniel, Maria, and Leo visit a desert. They wonder how the animals and plants survive where it is so dry.

text.content:
Sofie, Daniel, Maria, and Leo visit a desert. 
They wonder how the animals and plants survive where it is so dry.

What is a habitat?
What is a desert like?

How do animals and plants survive there? 
What about in other habitats?
Choose one to explore.

Work with a group. 
Plan your habitat. What is it like?
Draw your ideas.

What animals live there? 
Choose two to build. 
Make them the right size to fit with each other.
Program your animal to move.

Use your model and drawings to explain; 
what is your habitat like?

Use your model and drawings to explain;
what kind of animals did your group build for the habitat?

Build the habitat you designed. 
Add craft materials. 
Make it look real.

Explain how the animals are adapted to live there. 
Include evidence like reasons.
Great job!

teacher_support.things_you_will_need:
(one for every two students)
- LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Essential Set
- Device with the LEGO Education SPIKE App installed
- See Prepare - Materials.

lessons.title: SPIKE Essential Animals in Their Habitats

en-us.title: SPIKE Essential Animals and their Environments
en-us.unit_plan_description: Help Maria, Sofie, Leo, and Daniel explore ways that plants and animals grow and survive. What might happen if the environment changes? How can people help?
